com.tk.wightwhale.levels

Class LevelMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tk.wightwhale.levels.LevelMap

  • public class LevelMap
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LevelMap()
      Default constructor Sets max width + height as 0, position as 0,0 and levelId as the default
      LevelMap(int maxWidth, int maxHeight, java.lang.String id)
      Custom constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void constructSegments()
      This initializes the GameSegment data structure It clears the map when called
      java.lang.String getLevelId()
      Gets the level name / ID Note that com.tk.wightwhale.levels can only be retrieved by number, not ID, unlike GameObjects
      GameSegment getSegment(int x, int y)
      Returns a specific segment at location x and y
      GameSegment move(int horizontal, int vertical)
      Retrieves the Game Segment specified at the horizontal + vertical distance from current

      Puts a gameSegment in the specified map location
      void setLevelId(java.lang.String levelId)

    • Constructor Detail

      • LevelMap

        public LevelMap()
        Default constructor Sets max width + height as 0, position as 0,0 and levelId as the default

      • LevelMap

        public LevelMap(int maxWidth,
                int maxHeight,
                java.lang.String id)
        Custom constructor
        Parameters:
        maxWidth - maximum number of gameSegments on X axis
        maxHeight - maximum number of gameSegments on Y axis
        id - level ID

    • Method Detail

      • constructSegments

        public void constructSegments()
        This initializes the GameSegment data structure It clears the map when called

      • getSegment

        public GameSegment getSegment(int x,
                              int y)
        Returns a specific segment at location x and y
        Parameters:
        x - X axis position of gameSegment
        y - Y axis position of gameSegment
        Returns:
        GameSegment or null if invalid location / default ID

      • putSegment

        public boolean putSegment(int x,
                          int y,
                          GameSegment gs)
        Puts a gameSegment in the specified map location
        Parameters:
        x - X axis position
        y - Y axis position
        gs - GameSegment to include
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if x or y invalid

      • move

        public GameSegment move(int horizontal,
                        int vertical)
        Retrieves the Game Segment specified at the horizontal + vertical distance from current
        Parameters:
        horizontal - number of X-axis segments to move (-/+ for direction)
        vertical - number of Y-axis segments to move (-/+ for direction)
        Returns:
        GameSegment found or null if none stored in that location

      • getLevelId

        public java.lang.String getLevelId()
        Gets the level name / ID Note that com.tk.wightwhale.levels can only be retrieved by number, not ID, unlike GameObjects
        Returns:
        level ID

      • setLevelId

        public void setLevelId(java.lang.String levelId)
        Sets the level name / ID
        Parameters:
        levelId - the ID / string name of the level
